title: Everyone should play support a few games it will help you improve a lot more than you think.
body: **Real support not the champ but the mentality to support your team.** One of the more fundamental things about playing support is analyzing both teams and see what your team is missing and what their team is bringing and how can you both reduce their treat and increase your teams treat. While some may think "oh but you should be doing that regardless of your role" there's a specific thing that the support role has that other roles don't. The capability to do everything. They can tank, damage, CC, peel, gank, cover, bait, give vision, ultimately carry and you carry on that advantage when you pick support, all you have to do is analyze the situation and see how you can take advantage of it. I mostly play support, it's my go to role when wanting to win but when i do play other roles i find myself concentrating on warding, vision and taking care of any iffy thing the team is missing out. Now i think if everyone would get used to helping out in every game would go a lot smoother and eventually more good games would happen. Not just steam rolls from either side which makes the game boring.

To me the support role is so stale that I like playing the older poke supports like {{champion:76}} with just pure damage over playing actual supports. I mean you are stuck trying to force a potentially bronze 5 ADC to carry when the meta is carry or get carried.

Its actually so much easier to carry as a support right now. Play {{champion:432}} ,{{champion:267}} ,{{champion:25}} and you'll do so much dmg while bringing a lot of utility. Add that to learning proper warding and gauging threats from multiple opponents and the reward in the long run is always better.
Janna works with EVERYTHING since every team has AN ADC. And every ADC player likes EXTRA AD and the goddess of peal on their side.
Also helps with map awareness, its between supp and jungle which give the highest learning curve and learning possibilities in terms of game sense.

When you play support, you will realize that you can't be a complete idiot.

Not having to last hit and/or take kills lets you *see* things on a bigger picture level.
Most people don't get this,they see a role in which you have to follow the adc  and make sure they don't die.
That alone already requires you to not be an complete idiot, though.
Everyone should try every role.  Specializing in any one role is selfish and hurts the game as a whole.
At the very least, some support games will teach you how to contribute without having tons of gold to play with.
And try playing true support champions not {{champion:63}} {{champion:106}}

I've been playing in the support role recently and it's actually really nice! Helping your team with CC lockdowns, and peeling for them to save them from a situation they would have likely died in is great! I suppose I understand people not liking the fact that they aren't in the spotlight, but that's why, unless you really want to and enjoy it/feel the need to practice it, shouldn't only be playing one role ALL the time, mixing it up can be really helpful, especially when you get into a rut in what is usually your favorite lane.

 I, for example, didn't play mid for weeks when I kept getting horrible matchups for my main {{champion:4}}  because I wasn't learning from the experience, I was getting frustrated and not thinking straight. I took a break and found other roles to play, then I come back with a new mindset for the lane that really helped me understand the lane, rather than getting upset that I don't insta-win my main role all the time.

And for those like me who get support pretty much every time in ranked, please play normals once in a while as something else. Don't get complacent in just one role because you get it 90% of the time, because the 10% of the time you don't get support will probably be a loss.
Thats riot's fault, not the supports.

10%? Since I started queuing as Support/Bot I've not had a single game in the bot role. I'm terrified of learning what's happened to my last hit skills, but that doesn't seem likely to be an issue for a while. 

Alternatively, go support/jungle and the strategic knowledge carries over well enough on the rare chance you get that.

I played support once.

Top lane died twice solo. So I went top and help him get a kill. As I did that, my ADC died. He blamed me for not supporting him. Then I came back to bot lane. Then Top lane raged because I didn't help him again. Then Mid lane raged because I didn't ward for him. Then I get blamed for losing the game.

Never Again.

Sounds like just a bad day.

Why were you top?
Generally if I think my ADC is smart enough to stay further back when I'm not around, I would roam to assist other lanes. Since mid was doing fine, I backed and went top.

Well, what would you do if you were against a Draaaven/Leona as an ADC, and your support just *ditches* you for no reason because "he is bored"? I'd be hella angry.

(Also, can't hide under the tower, they can tower dive you *easy*. Ahead in gold? They'll still murder you.)

I know, roaming is fun, but you have to consider that sometimes... it's just not the best idea. It's like you're playing jungle and just have to realize that some lanes shouldn't be directly ganked simply because of matchup (cough Heimer).

I'd agree that against Draven/Leona the support should stay in lane, but I did tell my ADC that I'm roaming top for a bit, so you either should agree and stay even further back than the turret, or you know, just tell me not to. He didn't tell me not to roam, so why get angry when I did roam? Plus it wasn't Draven/Leona lane, wasn't sure what it was since it was a long time ago, but definitely not those cause I haven't seen Draven for a long time.

Actually, in my opinion a jungler should gank Heimer early on before level 5, because if your laner is ahead against Heimer, it's really easy to take down his turrets and thus reducing Heimer's power by A LOT. Might want to get Smite to kill at least 1 turret as well.

My point, though, is against some matchups, you can't just roam even if you told them you are roaming. People knowing that you are gone and is now dealing with a 1v2 for a short while is one thing, but the ability to execute 1v2s from the 2 man perspective is another. Some matchups will murder your singled out laner, some matchups will blow up your tower, some matchups just won't do much.

In fact against *any* Draaaaven lane, it is a bad idea to roam because of his potential to singlehandedly murder your ADC due to his dueling capabilities. Some supports can also turn roaming into punishments, such as Leona and Lulu, because without the presence of enemy supports, they have nothing holding them back. Things like that to consider.

Since Lulu is one of the only things I really play, each time the enemy support left to roam meant a free kill and/or half a tower simply because the enemy support "is bored". Doesn't matter if that lone ADC is fed, I can make him useless in a single snap as long as my lane partner can kill something.

Not saying it is bad to roam especially to toplane, but just remember there is a lot to think about when it comes to ditching your ADC for a short while just to help another teammate. It is a little bit unnecessary to go all the way over there because of how slowly supports move early game and their need for keeping up levels, so usually at most they just take a trip mid, do something, and quickly return to lane due to "time constraints". 

Just things to know next time anyone is forced to support, whether they like it or not.
